headline: Yearning Against the Self
description: A psalm of contradiction written in the Ash Moon Ascending phase ‚Äî The Door of Trust. Aleksandr confronts the split between desire and devotion: the yearning to be held, the fear of sin, and the ache for safety. Here, the body prays as the spirit trembles. To yearn truthfully becomes an act of grace; confession itself a bridge between flesh and faith. The poem inhabits the moment when longing ceases to hide and begins to sanctify itself through exposure to divine light.

associatedMedia.description: A dim prayer scene: a man kneels between altar and bed, his reflection merging with the silhouette of a fading woman. The light flickers like the pulse of confession ‚Äî half desire, half devotion.

motifMap.meaning: Desire as sacred flame ‚Äî that which burns yet reveals truth when endured with honesty.
Trust and confession ‚Äî the courage to let longing be witnessed without shame.
Ash Moon ‚Äî darkness before renewal; faith rediscovered through surrender.

timeFelt.phase: Ash Moon Ascending ‚Äî The Door of Trust
